newsitem.title: CHINA: China's Lu Thai Textile to issue B shares in H1.
newsitem.headline: China's Lu Thai Textile to issue B shares in H1.

text.p: China's Lu Thai Textile Co Ltd expects to issue 80-100 million foreign currency B shares in the first half of this year, company officials said on Tuesday.
"The B share issue will be launched in the first half," a company spokesman said by telephone from headquarters in Zibo city, eastern Shandong province.
"The offer could be completed by end-April if good progress is made," he said.
But the exact amount of B shares to be issued would have to be approved by the China Securities Regulatory Commission, he said.
Lu Thai Textile aims to raise 160-200 million yuan ($19-$24 million) through the initial public offer, he said. The shares would be listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.
The China Southern Securities Co has been named as the main domestic underwriter but an international coordinator had yet to be found, the official said.
The firm is among the 33 domestic companies approved to list B shares by the Securities Commission of the State Council.
Funds raised would be used for production expansion, he said. The company aims to boost annual production capacity to 30,000 spindles and 20 million metres of yarn-dyed fabric, he said.
Lu Thai Textile Co is a joint venture between the Zibo No.7 Textile Factory and Thai Rung Textile Co of Thailand, a second company official said.
The company's gross output value reached 220 million yuan in 1996, up from 150 million yuan in 1995, she said.
It made 19.14 million yuan in post-tax profits in 1995, up from 17.66 million yuan in 1994, she said. The official did not provide profit figures for 1996.
